scripts.text:
truncate table  DimDate ;
------------------------------------
DECLARE @start DATE = '2015-01-01'
WHILE @start < GETDATE()
BEGIN
	INSERT INTO  DimDate(DateKey,
						 Date,
	                     Year, 
						 Month, 
						 DayOfMonth, 
						 WeekOfYear,
						 DayOfWeek, 
						 Quarter,
						 MonthName,
						 DayOfWeekName,
						 QuarterName)
						 
	VALUES( CONVERT(INT, CONVERT(VARCHAR(8), @start, 112)),
			@start,
	        DATEPART(YY,@start),
			DATEPART(mm,@start),
			DATEPART(dd,@start), 
			DATEPART(wk,@start),
			DATEPART(dw,@start),
			DATEPART(QQ,@start),
			DATENAME(mm,@start),
			DATENAME(dw,@start),
			CAST(DATEPART(YEAR, @start) AS NVARCHAR(5)) + ' - Q' + CAST(DATEPART(QUARTER, @start) AS NVARCHAR(5))		
			)
	
	SET @start = DATEADD(dd,1,@start)
  END
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
